segment.source: Get started with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) (Windows 10)
segment.target: Get started with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic will help you gain a better understanding of how to use the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 in particular, as part of a Windows operating system deployment.
segment.target: This topic will help you gain a better understanding of how to use the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 in particular, as part of a Windows operating system deployment.

segment.source: Get started with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT)
segment.target: Get started with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT)

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic will help you gain a better understanding of how to use the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 in particular, as part of a Windows operating system deployment.
segment.target: This topic will help you gain a better understanding of how to use the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), and MDT 2013 Update 2 in particular, as part of a Windows operating system deployment.

segment.source: MDT is one of the most important tools available to IT professionals today.
segment.target: MDT is one of the most important tools available to IT professionals today.

segment.source: You can use it to create reference images or as a complete deployment solution.
segment.target: You can use it to create reference images or as a complete deployment solution.

segment.source: MDT 2013 Update 2 also can be used to extend the operating system deployment features available in Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: MDT 2013 Update 2 also can be used to extend the operating system deployment features available in Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: In addition to familiarizing you with the features and options available in MDT 2013 Update 2, this topic will walk you through the process of preparing for deploying Windows 10 using MDT by configuring Active Directory, creating an organizational unit (OU) structure, creating service accounts, configuring log files and folders, and installing the tools needed to view the logs and continue with the deployment process.
segment.target: In addition to familiarizing you with the features and options available in MDT 2013 Update 2, this topic will walk you through the process of preparing for deploying Windows 10 using MDT by configuring Active Directory, creating an organizational unit (OU) structure, creating service accounts, configuring log files and folders, and installing the tools needed to view the logs and continue with the deployment process.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and MDT01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and MDT01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.

segment.source: MDT01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: MDT01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
